Lemma 12.  If p is odd and p \ D then f cop = Npjp, 
This is a special case of Theorem 2.  2.  5 of [ 23 ] ; alternatively it may be proved in the same way as Lemma 11,  remembering that in finding Np we include the point at infinity.

f cog — 2 ; in eoery other case J cog = 1. 
We omit the proof of the lemma,  which is similar to that of Lemma 11.  It is necessary to consider a very large number of distinct cases,  and though none of them individually presents much difficulty,  the succession becomes wearisome.
